metadata.title: CVE-2020-29568 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in Xen through 4.14.x. Some OSes (such as Linux,FreeBSD, and NetBSD) are processing watch events using a single thread. Ifthe events are received faster than the thread is able to handle, they willget queued. As the queue is unbounded, a guest may be able to trigger anOOM in the backend. All systems with a FreeBSD, Linux, or NetBSD (anyversion) dom0 are vulnerable.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-29568` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-203-generic - 4.4.0-203.235
linux-image-4.4.0-203-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-203.235
linux-image-4.4.0-203-lowlatency - 4.4.0-203.235
linux-image-4.4.0-203-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-203.235
linux-image-4.4.0-203-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-203.235
linux-image-4.4.0-203-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-203.235
linux-image-4.4.0-203-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-203.235
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-203-generic - 4.4.0-203.235
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-203-lowlatency - 4.4.0-203.235
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-136-generic - 4.15.0-136.140~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-136-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-136.140~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-136-lowlatency - 4.15.0-136.140~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-136-generic - 4.15.0-136.140~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-136-lowlatency - 4.15.0-136.140~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1088-kvm - 4.4.0-1088.97
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1122-aws - 4.4.0-1122.136
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1094-aws - 4.15.0-1094.101~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1108-azure - 4.15.0-1108.120~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1093-gcp - 4.15.0-1093.106~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1065-oracle - 4.15.0-1065.73~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1146-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1146.156
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1150-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1150.160
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1074-fips - 4.4.0-1074.80
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1074-fips - 4.4.0-1074.80
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-1074-fips - 4.4.0-1074.80
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.4.0-1074-fips - 4.4.0-1074.80
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-203.235').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-136.140~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1088.97').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1122.136').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1094.101~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1108.120~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1093.106~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1065.73~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1146.156').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1150.160').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1074.80').
